Value.label: Basic Set
Value.Help: Basic Set Command value

Value.label: Delay
Value.Help: The delaying time to report to Group 1

Value.label: Remember Last
Value.Help: Remember the last status on plug

Value.label: Basic Set
Value.Help: Basic Set Command value

Value.label: Delay
Value.Help: The delaying time to report to Group 1

Value.label: Remember Last
Value.Help: Remember the last status on plug

Value.label: Minimum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 1.

Value.label: Maximum brightness level
Value.Help: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.

Value.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.

Value.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
Value.Help: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at automatic control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: The percentage of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 1-99 Default: 1

Value.label: Time of a dimming step at manual control
Value.Help: Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 2,55s) Default setting: 1

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)
Value.Help: Available settings: 0 - Function disabled; 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF. Default 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

Value.label: Force auto-calibration
Value.Help: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process.

Item.label: Start auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
Start auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

Value.label: Auto-calibration status
Value.Help: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

Item.label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings

Value.label: Burnt out bulb detection
Value.Help: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb) Default setting: 30

Value.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb
Value.Help: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer). Available settings: 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled; 1-255 - delay time in seconds; Default setting: 5

Value.label: Forced switch on brightness level
Value.Help: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage level of brightness; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Inputs Button/Switch configuration
Value.Help: Binary inputs type configuration. Default 0.

Item.label: Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

Value.label: The value sent to associated devices on single click
Value.Help: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

Item.label: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state.
Current Dimmer state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other Dimmers for example).

Value.label: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

Item.label: Device changes status on switch status change
Device status is synchronized with switch status

Value.label: Double click option
Value.Help: Double-click set lighting at 100%. Default 1.

Value.label: Command frames sent in 2-nd and 3-rd association groups (S1 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: Command frames sent in 4-th and 5-th association groups (S2 associations)
Value.Help: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching on or off the Dimmer (single click) will not be sent. Available settings: 0-31 0 - all actions send to association groups; 1 - do not send when switching on the Dimmer (single click); 2 - do not send when switching off the Dimmer (single click); 4 - do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing); 8 - do not send on double click; 16 - send 0xFF value on double click; Default setting: 0

Value.label: The function of 3-way switch
Value.Help: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch)

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group. Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure. Available settings: 0-15 0 - all groups (II-V) sent as non-secure; 1 - 2nd group sent as secure; 2 - 3rd group sent as secure; 4 - 4th group sent as secure; 8 - 5th group sent as secure; 15 - all groups (II-V) sent as secure; Default setting: 15

Value.label: Scene activation functionality
Value.Help: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. Default 0.

Value.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

Item.label: S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

Value.label: Load control mode
Value.Help: Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter value to 2.

Item.label: control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

Value.label: Load control mode
Value.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

Value.label: On/Off mode
Value.Help: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

Item.label: on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)

Value.label: Dimmability of the load
Value.Help: Dimmability of the load

Value.label: Soft-Start functionality
Value.Help: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

Value.label: Auto-calibration after power on
Value.Help: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

Item.label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)
Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb),

Value.label: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
Value.Help: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

Item.label: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or external switch
three atempts to turn on the load

Value.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads
Value.Help: Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive load (e.g. dimmable lEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation. In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust time of correction for flickering loads. Available settings: 0 - automatic correction disabled 1-254 - duration of correction in seconds 255 - automatic correction always enabled Default setting: 255

Value.label: Power limit - OVERLOAD
Value.Help: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Additional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default. Available settings: 0 - functionality disabled; 1-350 - 1W-350W; Default setting: 250

Value.label: Response to General Purpose Alarm
Value.Help: Response to General Purpose Alarm; Default 3.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Response to Water Flooding Alarm
Value.Help: Response to Water Flooding Alarm; Default 2.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
Value.Help: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm; Default 3.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Response to Temperature Alarm
Value.Help: Response to Temperature Alarm; Default 1.

Item.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

Value.label: Time of alarm state
Value.Help: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pressing the switches or sending the Z-Wave command frame.

Value.label: OVERLOAD alarm report
Value.Help: OVERLOAD alarm report (load power consumption too high)

Value.label: LOAD ERROR alarm report
Value.Help: LOAD ERROR alarm report (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

Value.label: OVERCURRENT alarm report
Value.Help: OVERCURRENT alarm report (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

Value.label: SURGE alarm report
Value.Help: SURGE alarm report (Dimmer output overvoltage)

Value.label: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report
Value.Help: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report

Value.label: Active power reports
Value.Help: The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. Available settings: 0 - power reports disabled; 1-100 (1-100%) - power report threshold; Default setting: 10 (10%)

Value.label: Periodic active power and energy reports
Value.Help: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report. Available settings: 0 - periodic reports disabled; 1-32767 (1-32767 seconds); Default setting: 3600 (3600s)

Value.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
Value.Help: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. This parameter works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level. Default setting: 0

Value.label: Self-measurement
Value.Help: The Dimmer may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

Value.label: Method of calculating the active power
Value.Help: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. This parameter is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. The parameter is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.

Item.label: power measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

Value.label: Energy reports
Value.Help: Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 0 - energy reports disabled; 1-255 (0,01 - 2,55 kWh) - report triggering threshold; Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh)

Value.label: Dim level when light is turned ON
Value.Help: You may select the dim level whenever the light is turned back ON to be either full brightness (100% dim level) or be the same as the last dim setting when the light is ON by flicking the wall switch

Value.label: Dimming/Brightening Step Level
Value.Help: You may change the dimming step level when you adjust the brightness by your controller/gateway. When the value is low, dimming/brightening is gradual. When the value is high, dimming/brightening is rapid.

Value.label: Dimming/Brightening Step Timing
Value.Help: You may change the dimming speed quicker or slower. When the value is low, the step timing is quick. When the value is high, the step timing is slow.

Value.label: Motion detection - sensitivity
Value.Help: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor is. Available settings: 8 - 255 Default setting: 15

Value.label: Motion detection - blind time
Value.Help: PIR sensor is blind (insensitive) to motion after last detection for the amount of time specified in this parameter. Shorter time periods allow to detect motion more frequently, but the battery will be drained faster. Available settings: 0 - 15 (0.5-8 seconds). Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value+1)) Default setting: 3

Value.label: Motion detection - pulse counter
Value.Help: This parameter determines the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor is. It is not recommended to modify this parameter settings! Default setting: 1 (2 pulses)

Value.label: Motion detection - window time
Value.Help: Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor is. It is not recommended to modify this parameter setting! Default setting: 2 (12 seconds)

Value.label: Motion detection - alarm cancellation delay
Value.Help: Time period after which the motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and associated devices. Any motion detected during this period resets the timer. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 30 (30 seconds)

Value.label: Motion detection - operating mode
Value.Help: This parameter determines in which part of day the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings. Default setting: 0 (always active)

Item.label: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

Value.label: Motion detection - night/day
Value.Help: This parameter defines the difference between night and day in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 200 (200 lux)

Value.label: BASIC command class configuration
Value.Help: This parameter determines the command frames sent to 2nd association group (assigned to PIR sensor). Default setting: 0 (ON and OFF)

Value.label: BASIC ON command frame value
Value.Help: The command frame sent at the moment of motion detection. Further motion detections, during the cancellation time, will not result in sending the association. Available settings: 0 - 255 Default setting: 255

Value.label: BASIC OFF command frame value
Value.Help: The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after cancellation delay time specified in parameter 6. Available settings: 0 - 255 Default setting: 0

Value.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
Value.Help: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group Lifeline. Available settings 0 - 15: 0 - none of the groups sent as secure 1 - 2nd group sent as secure. 2 - 3rd group sent as secure. 4 - 4th group sent as secure. 8 - 5th group sent as secure.

Value.label: Tamper - sensitivity
Value.Help: This parameter determines the change in force acting on the device, that will result in reporting tamper alarm - g-force acceleration. Available settings: 0 - 121 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive) Default setting: 20 (0.4g)

Value.label: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay
Value.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and associated devices. Any tampering detected during this period will not extend the delay. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 30 (seconds)

Value.label: Tamper - operating modes
Value.Help: This parameter determines function of the tamper and sent reports. It is an advanced feature serving much more functions than just detection of tampering. Default setting: 0 (Tamper)

Value.label: Tamper - alarm cancellation
Value.Help: This parameter allows to disable cancellation of the tamper alarm. Default setting: 0 (Tamper).

Item.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

Value.label: Tamper alarm broadcast mode
Value.Help: The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode can be received by all of the devices within range (if they accept such frames), but not repeated by them. Default setting: 0

Item.label: Tamper alarm sent to 3rd association group
Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode

Value.label: Tamper - backward compatible broadcast mode
Value.Help: The parameter determines whether the backward compatible tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode can be received by all of the devices within range (if they accept such frames), but not repeated by them. This parameter provides backward compatibility with controllers not supporting Z-Wave+. Default setting: 0

Item.label: Backward compatible tamper alarm sent to 5th association group
Backward compatible tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode

Value.label: Luminance report - threshold
Value.Help: This parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in luminance report being sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - reports are not sent. 1-32767 (luminance in lux). Default setting: 200 (200 lux).

Value.label: Luminance reports - interval
Value.Help: Time interval between consecutive luminance reports. The reports are sent even if there is no change in the light intensity. Available settings: 0 - 32767. 0 - periodical reports are not sent. 1-32767 (in seconds).

Value.label: Temperature report - threshold
Value.Help: This parameter determines the change in measured temperature that will result in new temperature report being sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5C; 0 = reports are not sent) Default setting: 10 (1C)

Value.label: Temperature measuring - interval
Value.Help: Time interval between consecutive temperature measurements. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. Available settings: 0 - 32767 (1 - 32767 seconds; 0 = temperature is not measured) Default setting: 900 (900 seconds).

Value.label: Temperature report - interval
Value.Help: Time interval between consecutive temperature reports. The reports are sent even if there is no change in the temperature. Available settings: 0 - 32767 (1 - 32767 seconds; 0 = periodical reports are not sent) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Temperature offset
Value.Help: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100C) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10C) Default setting: 0

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - signalling mode
Value.Help: This parameter determines the way in which visual indicator behaves after motion has been detected. Default setting: 10 (Flashlight mode)

Item.label: 1 long blink, LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white for 10 seconds.
Long blink, then short blink, LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white through 10 seconds. Each next detected motion extends the glowing by next 10 seconds.
Long blink, then short blinks White.
Long blink, then short blinks Red.
Long blink, then short blinks Green.
Long blink, then short blinks Blue.
Long blink, then short blinks Yellow.
Long blink, then short blinks Cyan
Long blink, then short blinks Magenta
Long blink, then 2 short blinks, LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Long blink, then 2 short blinks White
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Red
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Green
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Blue
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Yellow
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Cyan
Long blink, then 2 short blinks Magenta

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - brightness
Value.Help: This parameter determines the brightness of the visual LED indicator when indicating motion. Available settings: 0 - brightness determined by the luminance (parameters 82 and 83). 1-100 (1-100%) Default setting: 50 (50 %)

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - luminance for low indicator brightness
Value.Help: Light intensity level below which brightness of visual indicator is set to 1%. Available settings: 0 to value of parameter 83 (in lux). Default setting: 100.

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - luminance for high indicator brightness
Value.Help: Light intensity level above which brightness of visual indicator is set to 100%. Available settings: value of parameter 82 to 32767 (in lux) Default setting: 1000 (1000 lux) NOTE The value of the parameter 83 must be higher than the value of the parameter 82.

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - temperature for blue colour
Value.Help: This parameter is determines minimal temperature that will result in blue visual indicator colour. Relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured. Available settings: 0 to value of parameter 87 (in Celsius degree) Default setting: 18 (18C)

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - temperature for red colour
Value.Help: This parameter is determines minimal temperature that will result in red visual indicator colour. Relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured. Available settings: value of parameter 86 to 255 (in Celsius degree) Default setting: 28 (28C)

Value.label: Visual LED indicator - tamper alarm
Value.Help: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue). Default setting: 1 (on)

Value.label: True Period
Value.Help: This is the time the switching status needs to remain unchanged after a change to cause the device to send out a status message. 0 is Disabled.

Value.label: Send Out Basic Command
Value.Help: Enable or Disable Send Basic Command to Group 2 when the local button press changes the switching state.

Value.label: Meter Report Period
Value.Help: The device will report its meter value within the interval set. Set to 0 will disable the autoreporting function.
